item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Never be afraid to raise your voice for honesty and truth and compassion against injustice and lying and greed. If people all over the world...would do this, it would change the earth." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Whenever you feel like criticizing any one...just remember that all the people in this world haven't had the advantages that you've had." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Stuff your eyes with wonder, he said, live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Look for God. Look for God like a man with his head on fire looks for water." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Pearl S. Buck
item.description: "The person who tries to live alone will not succeed as a human being. His heart withers if it does not answer another heart. His mind shrinks away if he hears only the echoes of his own thoughts and finds no other inspiration. " -- Pearl S. Buck

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Frances Hodgson Burnett
item.description: "If you look the right way, you can see that the whole world is a garden." -- Frances Hodgson Burnett

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "Of all the inanimate objects, of all men's creations, books are the nearest to us for they contain our very thoughts, our ambitions, our indignations, our illusions, our fidelity to the truth, and our persistent leanings to error. But most of all they resemble us in their precious hold on life." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "I hope that real love and truth are stronger in the end than any evil or misfortune in the world." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "I never know what I think about something until I read what I've written on it." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "The man who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "You forget everything. The hours slip by. You travel in your chair through centuries you seem seem to see before you, your thoughts are caught up in the story, dallying with the details or following the course of the plot, you enter into characters, so that it seems as if it were your own heart beating beneath their costumes." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Human speech is like a cracked kettle on which we tap crude rhythms for bears to dance to, while we long to make music that will melt the stars." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "Human greatness does not lie in wealth or power, but in character and goodness. People are just people, and all people have faults and shortcomings, but all of us are born with a basic goodness." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "It's really a wonder that I haven't dropped all my ideals, because they seem so absurd and impossible to carry out. Yet I keep them, because in spite of everything, I still believe that people are really good at heart." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "The best remedy for those who are afraid, lonely or unhappy is to go outside, somewhere where they can be quite alone with the heavens, nature and God. Because only then does one feel that all is as it should be and that God wishes to see people happy, amidst the simple beauty of nature. As longs as this exists, and it certainly always will, I know that then there will always be comfort for every sorrow, whatever the circumstances may be. And I firmly believe that nature brings solace in all troubles." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "There’s a crack (or cracks) in everyone…that’s how the light of God gets in." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Denis Waitley
item.description: "The greatest gifts you can give your children are the roots of responsibility and the wings of independence." -- Denis Waitley

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Johann wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "The greatest thing in this world is not so much where we stand as in what direction we are moving." -- Johann wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "It is good to have an end to journey toward; but it is the journey that matters, in the end." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they had really happened and after you are finished reading one you will feel that all that happened to you and afterwards it all belongs to you: the good and the bad, the ecstasy, the remorse and sorrow, the people and the places and how the weather was. If you can get so that you can give that to people, then you are a writer." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Life, with its rules, its obligations, and its freedoms, is like a sonnet: You're given the form, but you have to write the sonnet yourself. - Mrs. Whatsit" -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Jeanie add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman
